hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ussa': I was a slave of Umar ibn al-Khattab while I was a Christian. He would present Islam to me and say: 'If you became Muslim, I would use you to help me with the trust (of leadership), for it is not permissible for me to use you to help with the trust of the Muslims while you are not upon their religion.' So I refused him. He said: 'There is no compulsion in the religion.' When his death approached, he freed me while I was still a Christian, and said: 'Go wherever you wish.' I asked Sharik: Did Abu Hilal hear this directly from Ussa'? He said: 'He claimed so.'

hadiths.english_translation: Biographical narrative: Yazid ibn Qatan ibn Ziyad ibn al-Harith ibn Malik, from Mudhaj tribe, narrated from Umar ibn al-Khattab. Umar used to say: Show me a man who, when he is among people as their leader, seems as if he is not their leader, and when he is among them not as a leader, seems as if he is. They said: We only know of al-Rabi' ibn Ziyad ibn Anas. He was humble and righteous, and ruled Khurasan and conquered much of it. He had a brother called al-Muhajirbii Ziyad, who was righteous and was killed with Abu Musa al-Ash'ari as a martyr at Tustar. A poet said [about him]: 'And the day Abu Musa stood with his sermon, al-Muhajir went in good standing. The house is the house of Bani al-Dayyan, we know it, among the family of Mudhaj, like precious jewels.'

When he saw me, he said: 'O son of my brother, the bones of my spine have deteriorated, and my back, so there is no position of rest except what you see. By Allah, I do not love...[text continues]'

He said: 'In good health, we praise Allah.' He said: 'How is the time treating you?'
